statement:
Let $H$ be a Hilbert space and $B(H)$ the algebra of bounded operators
in $H$. Suppose $T \in B(H)$ is a normal operator. Then

1.  - If $\lambda \in \mathbb{C}$ is an eigenvalue of $T$, then
    $\overline{\lambda}$ is an eigenvalue of $T^*$ (the adjoint operator
    of $T$) for the same eigenvector.

2.  - Eigenvectors of $T$ associated with distinct eigenvalues are
    orthogonal.

[**Remark -**]{} It is known that for any linear operator eigenvectors
associated with distinct eigenvalues are linearly independent. 2
strengthens this result for normal operators.
